Therefore, the Fortran program can be written as:

program main
  implicit none
  integer :: N, M, x, y, i, counter
  logical, dimension(:), allocatable :: red
  integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: num
  ! Read N and M
  read(*,*) N, M
  allocate(num(N), red(N))
  num = 1
  red = .false.
  red(1) = .true. do i = 1, M
    read(*,*) x, y
    x = x -1
    y = y -1
    call move_box(x, y, num, red)
  end do
  counter = count(red)
  ! Second program's logic: count until first zero in input (which is counter)
  !
children.label: language_mapping

children.text:
Since input is a single number, the result is 1 unless it's zero, but even then it's 1. write(*,*) 1
contains
  subroutine move_box(x, y, num, red)
    integer, intent(in) :: x, y
    integer, dimension(:), intent(inout) :: num
    logical, dimension(:), intent(inout) :: red
    if (num(x) == 0) then
      return
    else if (num(x) == 1) then
      num(x) = 0
      num(y) = num(y) + 1
      if (red(x)) then
        red(y) = .true.
      end if
      red(x) = .false. else
      num(x) = num(x) -1
      num(y) = num(y)
children.label: mental_execution

children.text:
+1
      if (red(x)) then
        red(y) = .true.
children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
end if
    end if
  end subroutine move_box
end program main
